PARAGRAPH.STRING: ([Georgian: იოსებ ჯუღაშვილი]; [Russian: Ио́сиф Виссарио́нович Джугашвили], Iosif Vissarionovich Dzhugashvili December 18, 1878 - March 5, 1953), better known by the adopted name of Joseph Stalin, alternatively transliterated Josef Stalin, was the de facto leader and in the Western view, dictator of the Soviet Union from about 1928 to
held the title General Secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union (1922-1953), a position that did not originally have significant influence, but through
ascendancy, became that of party leader. Between 1934 and 1953 that position was, nominally, just one of several Central Committee Secretaries, but
